metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26373 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts in some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. Pawan Kumar Gupta, Alyssa Milburn, Amit Peled, Shani Rehana, Nir Shildan and Ariel Sabba discovered that some Intel processors with Enhanced Indirect Branch Restricted Speculation (eIBRS) did not properly handle RET instructions after a VM exits. A local attacker could potentially use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-lowlatency - 4.4.0-242.276
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1158-aws - 4.4.0-1158.173
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, please refer to USN-6007-1.

criterions.comment: buffer package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-242.276').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1158.173').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
